solution_line_template: If Minnie mounts three more horses per day than there are days in a week, then Minnie mounts {days_in_week}+{minnie_more_than_week}=<<{minnie_more_than_week}+{days_in_week}={minnie_per_day}>>{minnie_per_day} horses per day.
Twice as many horses per day as Minnie mounts is {minnie_per_day}*{multiplier_for_twice}=<<{minnie_per_day}*{multiplier_for_twice}={twice_minnie}>>{twice_minnie} horses per day.

If Mickey mounts six less than twice as many horses per day as does Minnie, then Mickey mounts {twice_minnie}-{mickey_less_than_twice_minnie}=<<{twice_minnie}-{mickey_less_than_twice_minnie}={mickey_per_day}>>{mickey_per_day} horses per day.
Since there are {days_in_week} days in a week, then Mickey mounts {days_in_week}*{mickey_per_day}=<<{days_in_week}*{mickey_per_day}={mickey_per_week}>>{mickey_per_week} horses per week.
